description:
Option 1:
#!/bin/bash
Description: Shebang Bash executor.
Option 2:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
Description: Shell searchs for the first match of bash in the $PATH environment variable.
It can be useful if you aren't aware of the absolute path or don't want to search for it.

elseif.description: Add an elseif to an if statement.

description:
This defines a function named name.
The reserved word function is optional.
If the function reserved word is supplied, the parentheses are optional.
1. Recommended way:
name() {}
2. C-like-way:
function name [()] {}
case word in [ [(] pattern [ | pattern ] ... ) list ;; ] ... esac
A case command first expands word, and tries to match it against each pattern in turn.
The break command tells Bash to leave the loop straight away.
Enter the break or break (n) where n=number of loops.
